resources.string: An error occurred while loading HABPanel
The URL of the openHAB dashboard (based on hostname or IP). If configured, autodiscovery is disabled. Current setting: %s
The URL of the openHAB dashboard used when the local address is unavailable. Current setting: %s
Tap here to get some hints and explanations on how to set up SSL client certificate authentication
SSL client certificates are not supported by your device
Disable display switch off timer when openHAB is running
If you don\'t have an openHAB server, enable demo mode to get an imagination of what openHAB is capable of.
Note: Smaller scaling shrinks fonts and line widths, so there\'s more space for the graph, but font readability may suffer.
Generating charts can be taxing to the server. If you experience slow chart loading times and your server isn\'t powerful, disable this option to improve loading times.
You need to enable a screen lock for your device for enabling app access locking
Access to the app is not locked
Access to app settings is locked with Android screen lock or fingerprint
Access to the app is locked with Android screen lock or fingerprint\nNote: Widgets can be used nevertheless
Show all Sitemaps in side menu
Your server doesn\'t have HABPanel installed
Your device doesn\'t have a voice recognition app installed
The Sitemap could not be loaded. The following error occurred: %1$s
Connection unsuccessful. An unexpected response was received while trying to connect to the configured openHAB server (HTTP code %d).
Please enter a valid URL in a \'http(s)://host(:port)/\' form
Please enter a valid URL in a \'https://host(:port)/\' form
The port you have entered seems invalid for the selected protocol
SSL certificate isn\'t trusted. Please import the root certificate or accept the certificate during SSL handshake.
SSL certificate has been expired. Please get a new certificate or accept the certificate during SSL handshake.
SSL certificate isn\'t valid yet. Please get a correct certificate or accept the certificate during SSL handshake. Also check if the clock on your device is set correctly.
SSL certificate has invalid date. Please get a correct certificate and check if the clock on your device is set correctly.
SSL certificate has been revoked. Please get a new certificate or accept the certificate during SSL handshake.
SSL certificate is not valid for %s
Unexpected end of stream. Are you trying to connect to an HTTPS port via HTTP?
Currently this app doesn\'t support self-signed SSL certificates for Webview widgets
Authentication failed. Please check the configured username and password respectively the provided SSL client certificate (HTTP code %d).
URL is too long. Please use the IP address or a shorter URL (HTTP code %d).
HTTPS is required. Please change the URL (HTTP code %d).
Authentication failed. Please check the provided SSL client certificate (HTTP code %d).
SSL client certificate is required (HTTP code %d)
Your reverse proxy got an invalid answer from the openHAB server (HTTP code %d)
The openHAB server is temporarily unavailable (HTTP code %d)
Gateway time-out. Seems that your reverse proxy is running, but couldn\'t get an answer from the openHAB server (HTTP code %d).
The openHAB server hasn\'t enough free space (HTTP code %d)
Connecting to HTTPS port via HTTP?
Reverse proxy got invalid answer from openHAB (HTTP code %d)
Not enough free space on server (HTTP code %d)
Error while fetching openHAB server information
Your openHAB server is offline while the cloud instance is running
No browser found on your device
Event subscription failed, widget refresh may be impaired
Touch the tag and keep it close until the confirmation message appear
This device doesn\'t have NFC support
Item updates can be written to NFC tags. You can select an Item here or you can long click a widget on the Sitemap.
This page doesn\'t contain any widgets that are set to be visible
These Items are updated on corresponding events, e.g. an incoming phone call

The shorter the chosen interval is, the larger is the potential impact on the battery life of your device. Additionally, your device might not follow the chosen interval exactly, but delay the updates to reduce power consumption across apps.
The Item names on this page are prefixed with the device identifier \'%s\'
No prefix is set for the Item names on this page. You can prefix them with the device identifier, which can be set on the main settings page.
Listen for events associated with the following Items. This requires a persistent notification and may increase battery usage.
Listen for events associated with the following Items. This requires a persistent notification and may increase battery usage. This is only required for sending the DND mode.
Listening for events associated to DND mode
Listening for events associated to %1$s and %2$s
Listening for events associated to %1$s, %2$s and more
Tap here to get hints on how to set up this feature server-side
Sending call state has been disabled due to missing permissions
Sends Wi-Fi name (SSID) to Item \'%1$s\'. \"Location\" must be turned on, otherwise openHAB isn\'t allowed to get the Wi-Fi name.
Sending Wi-Fi name has been disabled due to missing permissions
Some background tasks have been disabled due to missing permissions
Waiting for network to send Item updates
Used to notify about pending background tasks, e.g. waiting for network to send battery level
Used to notify about errors in background tasks, e.g. got no network to send battery level
Listens for events to update Items accordingly. You can safely hide this category.
Notifications sent by the server with no defined severity
Notifications sent by the server with severity \'%1$s\'
Unavailable, error connecting to remote server: %s
Unavailable, remote server isn\'t an openHAB cloud instance
The notifications are polled on a regular schedule, which is the same than for \"Send device information to server\"
Please enter a valid Item name
Every 15 minutes while charging, every %s otherwise
Prefix the Item names of \"Send device information to server\" with this identifier

This device identifier can be any string and should be unique for all devices accessing your openHAB server. Besides the two use cases above, you can also use it as state on NFC tags, so you know which device read the tag.
Device identifier of scanning device (\"%s\" for this device)
Data sent to the server and voice commands aren\'t prefixed with a device identifier
No notifications were sent so far
An error occurred while loading notifications
The server certificate is not signed by a known Certificate Authority
Server could not authenticate as \"%s\". The certificate is only valid for:
Do you want to connect anyway?

We didn\'t find an openHAB server in your network. If you already have a server, please configure its IP address or host name in the server settings. If you don\'t yet have a server, you can enable demo mode to see what openHAB is capable of.
Connection to local server failed and you haven\'t configured a remote server
Trying to discover openHAB server instance\u2026
Waiting for Wi-Fi to establish connection\u2026
The log is too large to share. Please clear the log, reproduce the bug and share the log then.
On or hold to increase brightness
Off or hold to decrease brightness
The app also refreshes automatically, you normally don\'t need to do it manually
Most of your settings have been restored, except the server credentials
A vendor and technology agnostic open source automation software for your home
Control your home with your voice
Item control can be bound to NFC tags by long-pressing the Item
An error occurred while loading Items
Contact Items cannot receive Item commands, changed to update
Enable Tasker action plugin which allows updating Items via Tasker or other compatible apps
%s has been set to an empty string
Your device doesn\'t support creating widgets from inside an app. Please go to the widget menu on your home screen and create a widget from there.
Sitemap elements that may require larger data transfers are not loaded
The system wide data saver setting is followed when loading data-using sitemap elements
All sitemap elements are loaded, disregarding their data usage
%s was not loaded to save data
This tile can be configured in the openHAB app settings
Prompt for unlocking the device before allowing Item updates
Allow updating Items even if the device is locked

The state of the tile doesn\'t reflect the state of the Item.\nIf you have issues with tiles not being updated after changing them here, click on the tile or edit the quick settings of your device (the place that holds the toggles for e.g. Wi-Fi and Bluetooth).
